p: Sporadic introductions of MERS-CoV into humans are suspected to involve bats ( Ithete et al., 2013) and/or camels ( Reusken et al., 2013, Haagmans et al., 2014) with camels implicated as the likely source of most zoonotic infections of MERS-CoV in Saudi Arabia ( Alagaili et al., 2014). Meanwhile, there is considerable uncertainty about the extent of human-to-human transmission and it is unclear whether MERS-CoV has the potential for epidemic spread. Transmission appears limited among family members but may be amplified in health care settings ( Cotten et al., 2013, Breban et al., 2013). An understanding of the MERS-CoV epidemiology and transmission pathways are critically needed to devise effective surveillance, prevention and control strategies.
